element xaf
diagram
children dialogs sql-statements query-defn register-report-skin register-column-data-calc include pre-process report configuration register-value-source templates access-control
annotation
documentation 
This is the root tag for all of the XAF XML resource files. Although all of the children are ultimately owned by this element, please refer to each child to ensure that you place the XML tags in the appropriate file(s).

element xaf/dialogs
diagram
children dialog dialog-skin register-field
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
package  xsd:string  required      
annotation
documentation 
Application forms and dialogs are defined under this tag. This tag and its children typically reside in the file WEB-INF/ui/dialogs.xml.

element xaf/dialogs/dialog
diagram
children field.text field.memo field.composite field.grid field.static field.date field.time field.datetime field.duration field.boolean field.integer field.float field.select field.separator field.ssn field.phone field.email field.zip field.debug field.report field.uri field.currency field.file director populate-tasks execute-tasks client-js
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  required      
documentation 
The name of the dialog. The name may only contain upper or lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores. There should no punctuation characters or spaces and the name should be valid JavaScript name.
heading  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
Specifies the single value source that will provide the heading for the dialog.
class  java-class  optional  com.xaf.form.Dialog    
documentation 
Specifies a subclass of com.xaf.form.Dialog to dynamically load and instantiate instead of the default java class. This attribute is very useful when you want to use XML for the dialog definition but want to alter the behavior of the Dialog processing or want to some specific validation not allowed by the default class.
director-class  java-class  optional  com.xaf.form.DialogDirector    
documentation 
Specifies a subclass of com.xaf.form.DialogDirector to dynamically load and instantiate instead of the default java class used for dialog director. This is useful when you want more control over how submit and navigation buttons are created for the dialog.
loop  xsd:string  optional  append    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to show the dialog even after the dialog executes. Many websites commonly show forms after searches complete, this feature allows that capability.
loop-sep  xsd:string  optional  <p>    
documentation 
When loop is set to append or prepend, this attribute specifies the HTML that will be inserted either before or after the dialog and its execution content.
hide-readonly-hints  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to show hints for read-only values.
retain-params  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies the names of the URL parameters that should be retained during multiple invocations of this dialog. As dialogs are processed by browsers, the same dialog may be called during more than one request/response cycle. This parameter provides one or more comma-separated list of URL parameter names that should be kept between request/response cycles. If you would like to retain all parameters, pass an asterisk (*) as the value to this attribute.
annotation
documentation 
Specify an application form.

element xaf/dialogs/dialog-skin
diagram
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  required      
documentation 
The name of the skin.
class  java-class  optional  com.xaf.skin.StandardDialogSkin    
documentation 
The Java class that will be dynamically loaded when the given skin name is used. The class will be instantiated and the XML that is found in the dialog-skin element will be passed to the Java class's importFromXml method. The class provided must implement the com.xaf.form.DialogSkin interface.
annotation
documentation 
Create or register a dialog skin

element xaf/dialogs/register-field
diagram
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
tag-name  xsd:string  required      
documentation 
The tag name to use for the new field (should begin with "field.").
class  java-class  required      
documentation 
The Java class that will be dynamically loaded when the given tag-name is encountered. The class will be instantiated and the XML that is found in the field.xxx element will be passed to the Java class's importFromXml method. The class provided must extend the com.xaf.form.DialogField class.
annotation
documentation 
Register a new dialog field class.

element xaf/query-defn/field
diagram
children report
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
id  xsd:string  required      
documentation 
The unique id that his field will be known by. Typically, it is the same name as the column attribute but it can be more descriptive if need.
caption  xsd:string  required      
documentation 
Specifies the default column heading when the user views the data. When this field will be requested by the user, this attribute also specifies the default caption (the field label) that will appear in the dialog (but the dialog can override it).
join  query-defn-join-id  required      
documentation 
Specifies which join (using the join id) will retrieve the contents of this field.
column  xsd:string  required      
documentation 
The column name in the table specified by the join attribute where the data for this field resides. This attribute becomes the default for the column-expr, where-expr, and order-by-expr attributes if those attributes are not provided.
column-expr  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Defines the SQL expression that will be used for this field in the select clause of the SQL. This attribute overrides the default expression, which is just the column name specified in the column attribute.
where-expr  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Defines the SQL expression that will be used for this field in the where clause of the SQL. This attribute overrides the default expression, which is just the column name specified in the column attribute.
oder-by-expr  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Defines the SQL expression that will be used for this field in the order by clause of the SQL. This attribute overrides the default expression, which is just the column name specified in the column attribute.
annotation
documentation 
Defines a database column or column expression which will be allowed to be included in the generated SQL. A field is considered a virtual database column.

element xaf/configuration/property
diagram
type propertyType
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  required      
documentation 
The property name.
value  xsd:string  required      
documentation 
A static string or an expression that contains ${xxx} macros within the expression. The ${xxx} may refer to another property name or any single value source like ${create-app-url:/abc}.
final  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
If the property is marked as final, then the property will only be evaluated once during the lifetime of the property, even if the contents of the property are dynamic (like an expression). Basically, setting it to final="yes" is like a write-once constant.
descr  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The description of the property.
type  xsd:string  optional  text    
documentation 
The type of property.
annotation
documentation 
Define a single-valued property.

element dialog-fields/field.text
diagram
type field.textType
children client-js conditional popup
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The name of the field. If this field is a child of a composite or grid field, the name provided is automatically appended to the parent's name to create a unique name. The actual name of the control when the HTML is generated is usually _dc.name.
caption  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The caption or label that describes the usage of the field to the end user. If this field is a member of a composite or grid field thn the caption will only show if the parent field's show-child-caption is set to yes.
default  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The single value source (or list value source if appropriate) that specifies the default value of the field.
hint  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The text that will be shown to a user to provide a hint as to the usage of the field. The exact behavior of this attribute depends upon the skin being used, but typically the contents of the hint attribute are shown right under the field control.
required  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is required or not. If the field is specified as required, code is automatically generated that will enforce this validation rule.
read-only  xsd:string  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is read-only or not. If the value is set to yes, then the field's value becomes a static text string (will not generate a real HTML control). If the value is set to browser then the appropriate HTML control is still created but the control is marked read-only so the browser will not allow the value to be changed.
hidden  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is hidden or not. As a hidden field, the value of the field is still available to the programmer, but there will no field caption/label or input control available to the user.
visible  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is visible or not. As an invisible field, there is no value available to the programmer nor is there a caption/label, or control available to the user. Setting a field to visible=no is almost like comment out the field because most dialog skins will not process invisible fields.
create-adjacent-area  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to create a <span> element in the HTML adjacent to this field. If set to yes, then a <span> is created with the complete name of this field plus the word _adjacent. For example, if the field name is customer_id then the adjacent area will have the id customer_id_adjacent. This attribute is very useful when used in conjunction with popups.
col-break  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies whether a column break should be included before or after this field. The actual behavior of this attribute is determined by a skin, but typically if this field is a primary (top-level) field, the column break will create a dialog with multiple columns. If this field is a secondary field (child of composite), then a simple line break will be inserted between the composite siblings.
identifier  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to treat the contents of this field as an identifier. An identifier is a field whose values may only contain uppercase letters, numbers, and an unscore.
initial-focus  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to set the initial focus of the dialog to ths field. The last field to have this value set to yes (in creation order) will have the focus when the dialog is first displayed.
persist  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to automatically remember the last contents of this field (as a browser cookie) for the next time the user loads the dialog. This can be used in the place of the default attribute when the user's last input value should be used as the default for the field.
size  xsd:int  optional  32    
documentation 
The size (usually the number of characters) of text that the control should display at any given time.
max-length  xsd:int  optional  255    
documentation 
The maximum length of data that the control should allow.
uppercase  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the input should be uppercased or not.
lowercase  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the input should be lowercased or not.
trim  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the input should be trimmed (all leading and trailing whitespace removed).
mask-entry  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the input should be masked when entered. This means that data entry will be allowed but the control will not show the input. This is useful when getting passwords and other private data.
validate-pattern  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies a Perl5 regular expression that should be matched against the input data. This regular expression should be of the form [m]/pattern/[i][m][s][x]. Please see the Jakarta ORO API for more information about regular expressions.
validate-msg  xsd:short  optional      
documentation 
Specifies the error message to display if a validate-pattern is provided but the pattern does not match the input.
format-pattern  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies a Perl5 regular expression that should be used to format the input for display on the screen. The pattern should be of the form s/pattern/replacement/[g][i][m][o][s][x]. Please see the Jakarta ORO API for more information about regular expressions.
annotation
documentation 
A text field with optional regular expression validation.

rows  xsd:int  optional  3

documentation 
The number of columns that should be displayed in the memo control.
wrap  xsd:string  optional  soft    
documentation 
The type of word wrap that should be performed by the memo control. Hard means that the control will automatically insert line breaks for word wrapping. Soft indicates that visual word wrapping should occur in the control but no line breaks should be entered into the text.
annotation
documentation 
A memo or textarea field.

element dialog-fields/field.composite
diagram
type extension of field.compositeType
children field.text field.memo field.composite field.grid field.static field.date field.time field.datetime field.duration field.boolean field.integer field.float field.select field.separator field.ssn field.phone field.email field.zip field.debug field.report field.uri field.currency field.file
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The name of the field. If this field is a child of a composite or grid field, the name provided is automatically appended to the parent's name to create a unique name. The actual name of the control when the HTML is generated is usually _dc.name.
caption  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The caption or label that describes the usage of the field to the end user. If this field is a member of a composite or grid field thn the caption will only show if the parent field's show-child-caption is set to yes.
default  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The single value source (or list value source if appropriate) that specifies the default value of the field.
hint  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The text that will be shown to a user to provide a hint as to the usage of the field. The exact behavior of this attribute depends upon the skin being used, but typically the contents of the hint attribute are shown right under the field control.
required  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is required or not. If the field is specified as required, code is automatically generated that will enforce this validation rule.
read-only  xsd:string  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is read-only or not. If the value is set to yes, then the field's value becomes a static text string (will not generate a real HTML control). If the value is set to browser then the appropriate HTML control is still created but the control is marked read-only so the browser will not allow the value to be changed.
hidden  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is hidden or not. As a hidden field, the value of the field is still available to the programmer, but there will no field caption/label or input control available to the user.
visible  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is visible or not. As an invisible field, there is no value available to the programmer nor is there a caption/label, or control available to the user. Setting a field to visible=no is almost like comment out the field because most dialog skins will not process invisible fields.
create-adjacent-area  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to create a <span> element in the HTML adjacent to this field. If set to yes, then a <span> is created with the complete name of this field plus the word _adjacent. For example, if the field name is customer_id then the adjacent area will have the id customer_id_adjacent. This attribute is very useful when used in conjunction with popups.
col-break  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies whether a column break should be included before or after this field. The actual behavior of this attribute is determined by a skin, but typically if this field is a primary (top-level) field, the column break will create a dialog with multiple columns. If this field is a secondary field (child of composite), then a simple line break will be inserted between the composite siblings.
identifier  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to treat the contents of this field as an identifier. An identifier is a field whose values may only contain uppercase letters, numbers, and an unscore.
initial-focus  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to set the initial focus of the dialog to ths field. The last field to have this value set to yes (in creation order) will have the focus when the dialog is first displayed.
persist  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to automatically remember the last contents of this field (as a browser cookie) for the next time the user loads the dialog. This can be used in the place of the default attribute when the user's last input value should be used as the default for the field.
show-child-caption  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not the captions (field labels) of the children should be displayed. Even if the children of this field have captions, they will not be displayed unless this attribute is set to yes.
annotation
documentation 
A field that contains other fields that should be treated as a group.

captions  list-value-source  optional      
documentation 
Specifies a list value source that will provide the captions (column headings) for the grid.
annotation
documentation 
A field that contains a list of composite fields that are treated as grid rows and the fields inside the composites as grid columns.
documentation 
This field requires at one or more composite fields that will represent the rows in the grid. Each composite becomes a row and the children of the composites become the columns. If no captions attribute is specified for the grid, then the captions of the fields in the first composite field become the column headings for the grid. A potential way of allowing many rows but only showing a few at a time is to use the conditional features for each composite.

documentation

annotation
documentation 
A static or uneditable field that useful for displaying arbitrary text or labels.

documentation 
The maximum value allowed.

documentation 
Specifies whether only values in the future should be allowed.
past-only  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether only values in the past should be allowed.

documentation 
Specifies whether strict years (4 digit) are required.

Specifies whether strict time is required.

element dialog-fields/field.datetime
diagram
type field.datetimeType
children client-js conditional popup
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The name of the field. If this field is a child of a composite or grid field, the name provided is automatically appended to the parent's name to create a unique name. The actual name of the control when the HTML is generated is usually _dc.name.
caption  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The caption or label that describes the usage of the field to the end user. If this field is a member of a composite or grid field thn the caption will only show if the parent field's show-child-caption is set to yes.
default  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The single value source (or list value source if appropriate) that specifies the default value of the field.
hint  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The text that will be shown to a user to provide a hint as to the usage of the field. The exact behavior of this attribute depends upon the skin being used, but typically the contents of the hint attribute are shown right under the field control.
required  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is required or not. If the field is specified as required, code is automatically generated that will enforce this validation rule.
read-only  xsd:string  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is read-only or not. If the value is set to yes, then the field's value becomes a static text string (will not generate a real HTML control). If the value is set to browser then the appropriate HTML control is still created but the control is marked read-only so the browser will not allow the value to be changed.
hidden  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is hidden or not. As a hidden field, the value of the field is still available to the programmer, but there will no field caption/label or input control available to the user.
visible  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is visible or not. As an invisible field, there is no value available to the programmer nor is there a caption/label, or control available to the user. Setting a field to visible=no is almost like comment out the field because most dialog skins will not process invisible fields.
create-adjacent-area  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to create a <span> element in the HTML adjacent to this field. If set to yes, then a <span> is created with the complete name of this field plus the word _adjacent. For example, if the field name is customer_id then the adjacent area will have the id customer_id_adjacent. This attribute is very useful when used in conjunction with popups.
col-break  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies whether a column break should be included before or after this field. The actual behavior of this attribute is determined by a skin, but typically if this field is a primary (top-level) field, the column break will create a dialog with multiple columns. If this field is a secondary field (child of composite), then a simple line break will be inserted between the composite siblings.
identifier  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to treat the contents of this field as an identifier. An identifier is a field whose values may only contain uppercase letters, numbers, and an unscore.
initial-focus  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to set the initial focus of the dialog to ths field. The last field to have this value set to yes (in creation order) will have the focus when the dialog is first displayed.
persist  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to automatically remember the last contents of this field (as a browser cookie) for the next time the user loads the dialog. This can be used in the place of the default attribute when the user's last input value should be used as the default for the field.
size  xsd:int  optional  32    
documentation 
The size (usually the number of characters) of text that the control should display at any given time.
max-length  xsd:int  optional  255    
documentation 
The maximum length of data that the control should allow.
uppercase  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the input should be uppercased or not.
lowercase  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the input should be lowercased or not.
trim  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the input should be trimmed (all leading and trailing whitespace removed).
mask-entry  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the input should be masked when entered. This means that data entry will be allowed but the control will not show the input. This is useful when getting passwords and other private data.
validate-pattern  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies a Perl5 regular expression that should be matched against the input data. This regular expression should be of the form [m]/pattern/[i][m][s][x]. Please see the Jakarta ORO API for more information about regular expressions.
validate-msg  xsd:short  optional      
documentation 
Specifies the error message to display if a validate-pattern is provided but the pattern does not match the input.
format-pattern  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies a Perl5 regular expression that should be used to format the input for display on the screen. The pattern should be of the form s/pattern/replacement/[g][i][m][o][s][x]. Please see the Jakarta ORO API for more information about regular expressions.
min-value  xsd:dateTime  optional      
documentation 
The minimum value allowed.
max-value  xsd:dateTime  optional      
documentation 
The maximum value allowed.
future-only  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether only values in the future should be allowed.
past-only  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether only values in the past should be allowed.
strict-year  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether strict years (4 digit) are required.
strict-time  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether strict time is required.
annotation
documentation 
A combination date and time field.

Specifies whether or not to automatically remember the last contents of this field (as a browser cookie) for the next time the user loads the dialog. This can be used in the place of the default attribute when the user's last input value should be used as the default for the field.
style  select-field-style-enum  optional  combo    
documentation 
The style of control to use when getting the select value from the user.
choices  list-value-source  optional      
documentation 
A list value source that provides the choices for this field. The value may also be a static string of the format "abc=def;ghi;jkl=mno" with semi-colons separating the choices and equal signs separating the caption from the value id. If the caption is the same as the value id, then no equal sign is required. Alternately, you can use the <choices><choice value="def">abd</choice><choice>ghi</choice> ... </choices> format to provide the static choices. The <choices> element would be a child of the select field and the <choice> elements would be children of the <choice> element.
prepend-blank  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to prepend the choices with a blank string.
append-blank  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to append the choices with a blank string.
caption-left  xsd:string  optional  Available    
documentation 
If the style is a multidual (twin list boxes) this attribute specifies what the caption is of the first listbox (the one with all the choices).
caption-right  xsd:string  optional  Selected    
documentation 
If the style is a multidual (twin list boxes) this attribute specifies what the caption is of the second listbox (the one with the selected choices).
multi-width  xsd:int  optional  125    
documentation 
If the style is a multidual (twin list boxes) this attribute specifies the width, in pixels, of the two list boxes.
control-separator  xsd:string  optional  <br>    
documentation 
If the style is radio or multicheck, this attribute specifies what HTML string should be used to separate each of the radio or checkbox items.
annotation
documentation 
A field that allows various input styles that allow choosing one or more of a set of choices

element dialog-fields/field.separator
diagram
type extension of dialog-field
children client-js conditional popup
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The name of the field. If this field is a child of a composite or grid field, the name provided is automatically appended to the parent's name to create a unique name. The actual name of the control when the HTML is generated is usually _dc.name.
caption  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The caption or label that describes the usage of the field to the end user. If this field is a member of a composite or grid field thn the caption will only show if the parent field's show-child-caption is set to yes.
default  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The single value source (or list value source if appropriate) that specifies the default value of the field.
hint  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The text that will be shown to a user to provide a hint as to the usage of the field. The exact behavior of this attribute depends upon the skin being used, but typically the contents of the hint attribute are shown right under the field control.
required  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is required or not. If the field is specified as required, code is automatically generated that will enforce this validation rule.
read-only  xsd:string  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is read-only or not. If the value is set to yes, then the field's value becomes a static text string (will not generate a real HTML control). If the value is set to browser then the appropriate HTML control is still created but the control is marked read-only so the browser will not allow the value to be changed.
hidden  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is hidden or not. As a hidden field, the value of the field is still available to the programmer, but there will no field caption/label or input control available to the user.
visible  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is visible or not. As an invisible field, there is no value available to the programmer nor is there a caption/label, or control available to the user. Setting a field to visible=no is almost like comment out the field because most dialog skins will not process invisible fields.
create-adjacent-area  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to create a <span> element in the HTML adjacent to this field. If set to yes, then a <span> is created with the complete name of this field plus the word _adjacent. For example, if the field name is customer_id then the adjacent area will have the id customer_id_adjacent. This attribute is very useful when used in conjunction with popups.
col-break  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies whether a column break should be included before or after this field. The actual behavior of this attribute is determined by a skin, but typically if this field is a primary (top-level) field, the column break will create a dialog with multiple columns. If this field is a secondary field (child of composite), then a simple line break will be inserted between the composite siblings.
identifier  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to treat the contents of this field as an identifier. An identifier is a field whose values may only contain uppercase letters, numbers, and an unscore.
initial-focus  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to set the initial focus of the dialog to ths field. The last field to have this value set to yes (in creation order) will have the focus when the dialog is first displayed.
persist  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to automatically remember the last contents of this field (as a browser cookie) for the next time the user loads the dialog. This can be used in the place of the default attribute when the user's last input value should be used as the default for the field.
heading  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The heading to use for the separator.
annotation
documentation 
A field that separates other fields from each for visual effectiveness.

validate-msg  xsd:short  optional      
documentation

documentation

annotation
documentation

If the value is set to browser then the appropriate HTML control is still created but the control is marked read-only so the browser will not allow the value to be changed.
hidden  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is hidden or not. As a hidden field, the value of the field is still available to the programmer, but there will no field caption/label or input control available to the user.
visible  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is visible or not. As an invisible field, there is no value available to the programmer nor is there a caption/label, or control available to the user. Setting a field to visible=no is almost like comment out the field because most dialog skins will not process invisible fields.
create-adjacent-area  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to create a <span> element in the HTML adjacent to this field. If set to yes, then a <span> is created with the complete name of this field plus the word _adjacent. For example, if the field name is customer_id then the adjacent area will have the id customer_id_adjacent. This attribute is very useful when used in conjunction with popups.
col-break  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies whether a column break should be included before or after this field. The actual behavior of this attribute is determined by a skin, but typically if this field is a primary (top-level) field, the column break will create a dialog with multiple columns. If this field is a secondary field (child of composite), then a simple line break will be inserted between the composite siblings.
identifier  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to treat the contents of this field as an identifier. An identifier is a field whose values may only contain uppercase letters, numbers, and an unscore.
initial-focus  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to set the initial focus of the dialog to ths field. The last field to have this value set to yes (in creation order) will have the focus when the dialog is first displayed.
persist  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to automatically remember the last contents of this field (as a browser cookie) for the next time the user loads the dialog. This can be used in the place of the default attribute when the user's last input value should be used as the default for the field.
style  xsd:string  optional  radio    
annotation
documentation 
A field that executes a SQL statement and displays the results on a single page with radio buttons or checkboxes next to the result set.

element dialog-field/popup
diagram
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
action  xsd:anyURI  required      
documentation 
The URL to send to the popup window.
fill  dialog-field-names  required      
documentation 
A list of one or more fields that will be filled in using the hyperlinks generated by the page that displays in the popup window. If there is more than one field, separate them by commas but do not put whitespace between the commas. There are two options for filling in fields: appending data or replacing data. If a field name is preceded by a + then it means that the popup window should append data to the field, otherwise it will replace the data. Note that if you use the create-adjacent-area attribute of dialog field you can also fill in adjacent areas. Example: fill="text_field_00,+static_field_01,text_field_01_adjacent".
image-src  xsd:anyURI  optional      
documentation 
The icon used to specify the popup action (an automatic HREF is wrapped around this icon). The default image is a magnifying glass.
annotation
documentation 
Popup window and automatic fill-in of data specification

complexType field.compositeType
diagram
children field.text field.memo field.composite field.grid field.static field.date field.time field.datetime field.duration field.boolean field.integer field.float field.select field.separator field.ssn field.phone field.email field.zip field.debug field.report field.uri field.currency field.file
used by
elements dialog-fields/field.composite dialog-fields/field.grid/field.composite
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The name of the field. If this field is a child of a composite or grid field, the name provided is automatically appended to the parent's name to create a unique name. The actual name of the control when the HTML is generated is usually _dc.name.
caption  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The caption or label that describes the usage of the field to the end user. If this field is a member of a composite or grid field thn the caption will only show if the parent field's show-child-caption is set to yes.
default  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The single value source (or list value source if appropriate) that specifies the default value of the field.
hint  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The text that will be shown to a user to provide a hint as to the usage of the field. The exact behavior of this attribute depends upon the skin being used, but typically the contents of the hint attribute are shown right under the field control.
required  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is required or not. If the field is specified as required, code is automatically generated that will enforce this validation rule.
read-only  xsd:string  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is read-only or not. If the value is set to yes, then the field's value becomes a static text string (will not generate a real HTML control). If the value is set to browser then the appropriate HTML control is still created but the control is marked read-only so the browser will not allow the value to be changed.
hidden  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is hidden or not. As a hidden field, the value of the field is still available to the programmer, but there will no field caption/label or input control available to the user.
visible  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is visible or not. As an invisible field, there is no value available to the programmer nor is there a caption/label, or control available to the user. Setting a field to visible=no is almost like comment out the field because most dialog skins will not process invisible fields.
create-adjacent-area  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to create a <span> element in the HTML adjacent to this field. If set to yes, then a <span> is created with the complete name of this field plus the word _adjacent. For example, if the field name is customer_id then the adjacent area will have the id customer_id_adjacent. This attribute is very useful when used in conjunction with popups.
col-break  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies whether a column break should be included before or after this field. The actual behavior of this attribute is determined by a skin, but typically if this field is a primary (top-level) field, the column break will create a dialog with multiple columns. If this field is a secondary field (child of composite), then a simple line break will be inserted between the composite siblings.
identifier  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to treat the contents of this field as an identifier. An identifier is a field whose values may only contain uppercase letters, numbers, and an unscore.
initial-focus  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to set the initial focus of the dialog to ths field. The last field to have this value set to yes (in creation order) will have the focus when the dialog is first displayed.
persist  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to automatically remember the last contents of this field (as a browser cookie) for the next time the user loads the dialog. This can be used in the place of the default attribute when the user's last input value should be used as the default for the field.
annotation
documentation 
Composite field type

documentation

validate-msg  xsd:short  optional      
documentation 
Specifies the error message to display if a validate-pattern is provided but the pattern does not match the input.
format-pattern  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies a Perl5 regular expression that should be used to format the input for display on the screen. The pattern should be of the form s/pattern/replacement/[g][i][m][o][s][x]. Please see the Jakarta ORO API for more information about regular expressions.

documentation 
Specifies whether only values in the past should be allowed.
strict-year  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether strict years (4 digit) are required.
strict-time  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether strict time is required.
annotation
documentation

element statementType/sql
diagram
annotation
documentation 
Specifies the SQL text, including bind parameters or dynamic replacements.
documentation 
The SQL can be comprised of just static text, static text with JDBC-style bind parameters using ?, or dynamic text with JDBC-style bind parameters. When using the JDBC-style bind parameters, the actual values of the bind parameters are provided using the params element. If a SQL IN clause it needed, you can use the ${param-list:x} format where x is the parameter number of a list value source. If you would like to just replace some portion of the SQL based on environment values, you can use one or more ${abc:def} style replacement macros that will be replaced using single-value sources.

element statementType/params
diagram
children param
annotation
documentation 
Specifies the SQL bind parametes in the order that they are defined in the SQL.

element statementType/params/param
diagram
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
value  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
Bind a single value source to a specific parameter in the SQL source.
values  list-value-source  optional      
documentation 
Bind a list value source to a specific parameter in the SQL source. This is typically used with the ${param-list:x} formatting macro (useful for creating SQL IN clauses). For example, "select * from x where y in (${param-list:0})".
type  statement-param-type-enum  optional      
documentation 
When the value (single value source) is specified, this type attribute can be provided to define the type of value to bind.

attributeGroup dialog-field
used by
complexTypes dialog-field field.compositeType
attributes
Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
name  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The name of the field. If this field is a child of a composite or grid field, the name provided is automatically appended to the parent's name to create a unique name. The actual name of the control when the HTML is generated is usually _dc.name.
caption  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The caption or label that describes the usage of the field to the end user. If this field is a member of a composite or grid field thn the caption will only show if the parent field's show-child-caption is set to yes.
default  single-value-source  optional      
documentation 
The single value source (or list value source if appropriate) that specifies the default value of the field.
hint  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
The text that will be shown to a user to provide a hint as to the usage of the field. The exact behavior of this attribute depends upon the skin being used, but typically the contents of the hint attribute are shown right under the field control.
required  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is required or not. If the field is specified as required, code is automatically generated that will enforce this validation rule.
read-only  xsd:string  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is read-only or not. If the value is set to yes, then the field's value becomes a static text string (will not generate a real HTML control). If the value is set to browser then the appropriate HTML control is still created but the control is marked read-only so the browser will not allow the value to be changed.
hidden  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is hidden or not. As a hidden field, the value of the field is still available to the programmer, but there will no field caption/label or input control available to the user.
visible  yes-no  optional  yes    
documentation 
Specifies whether the field is visible or not. As an invisible field, there is no value available to the programmer nor is there a caption/label, or control available to the user. Setting a field to visible=no is almost like comment out the field because most dialog skins will not process invisible fields.
create-adjacent-area  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to create a <span> element in the HTML adjacent to this field. If set to yes, then a <span> is created with the complete name of this field plus the word _adjacent. For example, if the field name is customer_id then the adjacent area will have the id customer_id_adjacent. This attribute is very useful when used in conjunction with popups.
col-break  xsd:string  optional      
documentation 
Specifies whether a column break should be included before or after this field. The actual behavior of this attribute is determined by a skin, but typically if this field is a primary (top-level) field, the column break will create a dialog with multiple columns. If this field is a secondary field (child of composite), then a simple line break will be inserted between the composite siblings.
identifier  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to treat the contents of this field as an identifier. An identifier is a field whose values may only contain uppercase letters, numbers, and an unscore.
initial-focus  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether to set the initial focus of the dialog to ths field. The last field to have this value set to yes (in creation order) will have the focus when the dialog is first displayed.
persist  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not to automatically remember the last contents of this field (as a browser cookie) for the next time the user loads the dialog. This can be used in the place of the default attribute when the user's last input value should be used as the default for the field.
annotation
documentation 
Basic attributes that can be set for all dialog fields

attributeGroup dialog-field-container

Name  Type  Use  Default  Fixed  Annotation
show-child-caption  yes-no  optional  no    
documentation 
Specifies whether or not the captions (field labels) of the children should be displayed. Even if the children of this field have captions, they will not be displayed unless this attribute is set to yes.
annotation

Basic attributes that can be set for dialog fields that act as containers
